page.title: 19Windmill Hill.
page.content: {Windmill Hill}is a nature reserve in our area.This reserve is fifteen acres and was bought in nineteen seventy nine by the Worcestershire Nature Conservation Trust.It is eight hundred metres north east of the Fish and Anchor Inn.The public can visit this site.It is on a slope and much of the land is rough pasture.Many flowers grow there including{bird's foot, {trefoil,purple orchid,vetch,milkwort, and{wild rose.}In the hedges there are oak and ash and some hawthorn.There are many signs of insect life.We saw ants,bees,beetles,grasshoppers, caterpillers,dragonflies,and butterflies.A{marbled white}and twenty two other species of butterfly have been seen here.There are also signs of badgers,foxes,rabbits,and other small mammals.We also saw Jacob sheep grazing.
